page.title: 11Religion: St.Erth Church
page.content: The Churchyard Extensions at different times have made the Churchyard a rather curious shape. It contains much of beauty in trees, shrubs and flowers. Some ancient a stones to be found in the Churchyard include a low cross near the porch, said to be Celtic in origin, and a granite cross found on a farm and now incorporated in a tombstone near the northern wall. The Lych-gate was given in memory of the parents of the Misses Vivien and near it is the stately cross of grey stone from the Forest of Dean, which is the village War Memorial. It is over 22 feet high, surmounted by a "Calvary", and was erected by the widow of Major Herbert Carter. v.c., whose grave is nearby.
